required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Aquatic Therapy in Children With Autism and Their Families

collaborator.agency: Franklin County Board of Developmental Disabilities

brief_summary.textblock: This is an aquatic occupational therapy group for children between the ages of 3-12 that have an autism diagnosis. Intervention will focus on increasing the child's safety swim skills.

detailed_description.textblock: Information will be collected from participants' guardians during an intake visit regarding a child's sensory processing deficits, movement abilities and exposure to swim skill instruction prior to the group. The group will provide swim instruction using the Halliwick approach to learning swim skills as well as other occupational therapy techniques such as shaping, therapeutic relationship and behavior management. Groups will have a minimum ratio of 1 staff to every 2 children, with the possibility of 1:1 ratio most days. There will be a certified lifeguard present at all times. Qualitative interviews and a follow up survey will be conducted with parents (ages 18+) to determine impact on families and individual participants. Swim skills will be tracked at each session via goal attainment scaling and daily documentation. Descriptive and correlational statistics will be completed as well as coding of interview and survey data. Participants can participate for one, 10 week session, or will have the option to participate in additional 10 week sessions until child participants top out on the WOTA or plateau in progress of swim skills.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, pre-intervention; immediately after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Change in swim skills measured with Water Orientation Test-Alyn; higher scores mean a better outcome. Minimum score is 0, maximum is 27

Goal Attainment Scaling to track change in other swim performance skills not measured above. Scores for each goal range from -2 (regression) to +2 (2 levels more than anticipated). A higher score indicates improvement.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline pre-intervention; immediately after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Custom questionnaire using 5 point Likert scale regarding comfort and importance of water participation for the child. A higher score indicates increased parent comfort, which is the desirable direction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one time after 8 hours of intervention have been provided to the child participant
primary_outcome.description: qualitative interview regarding parent perspective of the the intervention

arm_group.description: Group-based aquatic occupational therapy with 1:1 swim buddy for safety.

intervention.description: Group of 4-8 children, paired with a swim buddy. Intervention techniques including discrete teaching, shaping, behavioral management, therapeutic relationship and individualized goals.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pre-existing diagnosis of autism spectrum disorder from a medical professional
- family interest in swimming
Exclusion Criteria:
- ventilation system for breathing such as trachea not capped

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified data may be shared with other researchers.
